title: Fragment, early–mid-16th century
medium:
Medium: cotton 
Technique: double running stitch embroidery (the second stitch sometimes twists around the first instead of aligned with it on plain weave (three narrow strips sewn together)
description: Part of a white-on-white embroidered panel. Joining of three pieces needle made edge, the loops of which form two bands placed edge to edge are whipped together.  Linen bobbin lace sewn to three edges.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, early–mid-16th century.Medium: cotton 
Technique: double running stitch embroidery (the second stitch sometimes twists around the first instead of aligned with it on plain weave (three narrow strips sewn together). Bequest of Marian Hague. 1971-50-80.
